title: Full rebuild to implement the deep-dive multi-page TACTIC TRANSMIT portal blueprint

requirements.text: Restructure the public portal from a single long landing page into the blueprint’s interconnected multi-page site: Home, Product Deep-Dive, Board, Connect & Support, and Legal & Technical Docs, while keeping the existing Admin Dashboard route operational.

quotes: This is the finalized, deep-dive blueprint for the Tactic Transmit Official Portal. This multi-page, interconnected structure is designed to look like a high-tier engineering firm’s digital presence.
Page 1: The Home Page (The Pulse)
Full rebuild

acceptanceCriteria: App has separate routes/pages for: Home, Product, Board, Connect & Support, and Legal & Technical Docs (in addition to existing /admin, /terms, /privacy).
All navigation between these pages works on desktop and mobile.
Existing Admin Dashboard behavior remains available at /admin behind the existing auth/authorization guards.

requirements.text: Create a dedicated Product Deep-Dive page (The TT-1 Transmitter) with a technical schematic/blueprint visual style and four component modules, each showing a high-resolution macro image and the exact technical description text provided for: ESP32-WROOM-32, DS3231 High-Precision RTC, DFPlayer Mini (FN-M16P) + 24-bit DAC, and 1kΩ Impedance Matching Resistors.

quotes:
Page 2: Product Deep-Dive (The TT-1 Transmitter)
Visual Design: A "Technical Schematic" look with blueprints in the background. Each component is displayed with a high-resolution "Macro" photo.

2. Deep-Dive Product Details (For Page 2)
A. The Processing Core
 * Component: ESP32-WROOM-32.
 * Technical Detail: Features an integrated Dual-Core Xtensa® 32-bit LX6 microprocessor. We utilize "Task Pinning" logic—one core handles the Wi-Fi stack and NTP time-fetching, while the second core runs the time-critical audio interrupts. This prevents the "system stutter" found in cheaper, single-core bell systems.
B. The Chronometric Heart
 * Component: DS3231 High-Precision RTC.
 * Technical Detail: This module uses an Integrated Temperature-Compensated Crystal Oscillator (TCXO). Standard clocks drift as the room temperature changes; the TT-1 stays accurate within \pm2 minutes per year, even in extreme conditions.
C. The Auditory Engine
 * Component: DFPlayer Mini (FN-M16P).
 * Technical Detail: It decodes FAT16 and FAT32 file systems. By bypassing standard buzzing sounds and using a 24-bit DAC (Digital-to-Analog Converter), we achieve a Signal-to-Noise Ratio (SNR) of 85dB, providing studio-grade announcement quality.
D. The Safety Manifold
 * Component: 1k$\Omega$ Impedance Matching Resistors.
 * Technical Detail: Engineered by Dejon Justine, this stage acts as a Galvanic-style isolation buffer. It matches the low-voltage output of the microcontroller to the high-impedance input of the campus amplifier, eliminating "Pop" noises and protecting the school's hardware from DC offset.

acceptanceCriteria: Product Deep-Dive page exists as its own route and is reachable from global navigation.

The page contains exactly four component sections and each section includes (a) a macro photo image, (b) the component name, and (c) the exact technical detail text supplied in the blueprint (including special characters like Xtensa® and 1kΩ).
The page uses a blueprint/technical schematic visual background treatment that is distinct from the Home page presentation while remaining consistent with the overall portal theme.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose around them instead).
Keep all Motoko backend logic in the single actor file backend/main.mo (single-actor architecture).
Do not implement password-based authentication; Internet Identity must remain the only authentication mechanism.
Do not implement external email delivery; present the welcome email content in-app instead.
All user-facing text must be in English and must match the blueprint exactly where specified (headlines, labels, secure-gating message, contact lines, and provided email content).
nonGoals: Do not add third-party authentication providers (e.g., Google/GitHub/Auth0).
Do not integrate external email/SMS services for message routing or welcome emails.
Do not add real-time messaging/chat or WebSocket features.
Do not add external databases or non-IC storage systems.
